00033 #define DIG1394_FIRST_CAMERA   (~(unsigned long long)0)
00034 #define DIG1394_SECOND_CAMERA  (~(unsigned long long)1)
00035 #define DIG1394_THIRD_CAMERA   (~(unsigned long long)2)
00036 #define DIG1394_FOURTH_CAMERA  (~(unsigned long long)3)
00037 #define DIG1394_FIFTH_CAMERA   (~(unsigned long long)4)
00038 #define DIG1394_SIXTH_CAMERA   (~(unsigned long long)5)
00039 #define DIG1394_SEVENTH_CAMERA (~(unsigned long long)6)

00042 #define DIG1394_NTH_CAMERA(n)  (~(unsigned long long)(n))
00043 
00044 /*
00045   parameter format for XVDig1394::set_params is a string of "XnXn..."
00046   where X is the parameter character and n is the corresponding value
00047   valid characters and their values:
00048   B : number of buffers ( same as defined in XVVideo.h )
00049   R : pixel format from camera, 0 = YUV422, 1 = RGB, 2 = MONO8,
00050                                 3 = MONO16, 4 = YUV411, 5 = YUV444
00051                     default = 0 
00052   S : scale, 0 = any, 1 = 640x480, 2 = 320x200, 3 = 160x120, 
00053              4 = 800x600, 5 = 1024x768, 6 = 1280x960, 7 = 1600x1200
00054           default = 0
00055   M : scale (obsolete), M0 = S4, M1 = S5, M2 = S6, M3 = S7
00056   C : whether to grab center of the image or not, 0 = no, 1 = yes, default = 0
00057       note that C1 implies format 7
00058   T : external trigger, 0 = off, 1-4 = mode 0-3, or directly supply the
00059                         number to the camera. default = 0
00060   f : directly set IEEE 1394 camera format (as oppose to set R and S/M)
00061       if the value is 7, S values are still used.
00062   m : directly set IEEE 1394 camera mode   (as oppose to set R and S/M)
00063       note that this parameter should not to set for format 7
00064   r : frame rate, 0 = 1.875, 1 = 3.75, 2 = 7.5, 3 = 15, 4 = 30, 5 = 60 (fps)
00065                   default = fastest under selected format and mode
00066   g : gain
00067   u : u component for the white balance
00068   v : v component for the white balance
00069   s : saturation
00070   A : sharpness
00071   h : shutter
00072   a : gamma
00073   x : exposure
00074   o : optical filter
00075  */
00076 
00077 typedef enum
00078 {
00079   BAYER_Not_Valid=-1,
00080   BAYER_PATTERN_GBRG,
00081   BAYER_PATTERN_BGGR,
00082   BAYER_PATTERN_RGGB,
00083   BAYER_PATTERN_GRBG,
00084 }bayer_pattern_type;
00085 
00086 template <class IMTYPE>
